review: A decent device with a good number of positives, but a short number of negatives that really hurt its rating.First,positives. It has a good interface which is easy to navigate. Although it steers you towards buying Amazon content, you can still use other apps like Hulu or Netflix.However, it truly fails as a *streaming* device in that it skips and lags. A lot. Sometimes shows skip, jump, or lag about every minute, even with very fast internet access. Contacting support has the same advice every time, which only offers temporary fixes for the most part. It seems the hardware does not meet the ambitions of the device and its software. I can't wait to get the next Fire TV or Roku device.But at this point, honestly, Roku is looking better.

review: This is such a great entertainment investment! I got it so that we could stream Netflix and Prime without having to connect one of our computers to the tv. Being able to watch YouTube is a fun plus. Then my boyfriend discovered the games. Oh, the games! A lot of them can be played with just the remote. (Badland FTW!) Unfortunately, a lot of other games we wanted to play require the game controller and the TV Stick isn't compatible with it. So, we decided to upgrade to the box. What made us upgrade to the box faster was that the TV Stick's remote isn't durable enough to withstand marathon gaming sessions. (Zen Pinball is intense, and I cracked the remote's navigation ring.) The only other downside is that we had to change our router's security settings in order for the TV Stick to connect to the internet. This is, apparently, a sometimes issue with Xfinity.Bottom line: If you want HD streaming and light, casual gaming, get the TV Stick. It's well worth it!
